Package uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon

Root package for the MEKON framework, which contains all MEKON-specific exception classes, as well as providing the general overview documentation for the framework.

See: Description

  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    KAccessException
    Exception thrown when a client attempts to access any MEKON-related API in an illegal manner.
    KConfigException
    Exception thrown when some configuration problem is detected.
    KModelException
    Exception thrown when some problem with the MEKON model is detected.
    KRuntimeException
    Base class for all MEKON-specific runtime-exceptions.

Package uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon Description

Root package for the MEKON framework, which contains all MEKON-specific exception classes, as well as providing the general overview documentation for the framework.

MEKON Overview

MEKON is a framework for the creation of ontology-driven applications, wherein a set of externally represented ontologies, or ontology-like knowledge sources, together with associated reasoning mechanisms, are accessed via a generic in-memory frames model (FM) and automatically mutating instantiations of that model.

For a general overview of the MEKON framework and related software see mekon-hobo project website.

MEKON Packages

MEKON APIs

The Model API: provides the client representation of the FM.

The Mechanism API: provides the mechanisms for building and configuring the MEKON models. Incorporates the MEKON plug-ins API (or SPI - Service Provider Interface) that is used by providers of the following types of plug-in:

  • Model-section builders: Responsible for building sections of the FM derived from external knowledge sources of specific types
  • Reasoners: Responsible for dynamic updating of model-instantiations based on reasoning mechanisms associated with external knowledge sources of specific types
See below for further details on each of these APIs.

MEKON Class/Interface Naming Conventions

Within the MEKON API packages, the following single-character class-name prefixes are used to distinguish the broad category into which a class or interface falls:
  • I: Instance-level entities
  • C: Concept-level entities
  • M: Meta-level entities
  • F: Non-level-specific entities
The following prefixes are used within the other MEKON packages (see below for details):
  • N: Alternative node/link network representation
  • K: General/utility classes
  • Z: Internal MEKON linking package

Model API

Package: uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model

Models are loaded into the API as a concept-level CFrame/CSlot network. Individual model-instantiations can then by created by the client in the form of instance-level IFrame/ISlot networks.

The instance-level networks are dynamic in that any client-provided value-updates for slots on a particular frame may trigger automatic updates to the slot-set for that frame. These updates can be of the following types:

  • Addition/removal of slots
  • Updates to value-constraints for particular slots
  • Addition/removal of inferred values for particular slots
Such updates will be provided either by generic reasoning mechanisms associated with the external knowledge sources, or by procedural mechanisms associated with the OM.

Mechanism API

Package: uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model.motor

The CBuilder class is responsible for building the FM, which involves the following steps:

  • Registration of set of section-builder plugins, one for each ontology
  • Invocation of registered section-builder plugins
  • Return of resulting CModel object
The section-builder plugins are instances of specific extensions of CSectionBuilder, with each such extension being responsible for loading ontologies of a specific type. The section-builders will use mechanisms accessible from CBuilder to create and register an appropriate set of FM entities. The section-builders are also responsible for providing reasoning plugins, in the form of specific implementations of IReasoner, and attaching them to appropriate frames, over whose instantiations they will perform any required reasoning.

The registration of the section-builder plugins can be done either via the API or via the MEKON configuration system.

Model/Mechanism Dependencies

The model and mechanism packages, in addition to providing the respective APIs, also collectively provide the implementations for those APIs. This involves circular dependencies between the two packages at the implementation level, though at the API level the dependencies are strictly one way - from mechanism to model. Hence we have:

API dependencies:

  • Mechanism ==> Model
Implementation dependencies:
  • Mechanism <==> Model

General/Utility Packages

In addition to the main API packages, MEKON provides the following general/utility packages:
  • Exceptions: uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon
  • Configuration-Related: uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.config
  • Network Representation: uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.network (provides a simple light-weight node/link representation, for use by specific classification and query-matching plugins)
  • General Utilities: uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.util

Internal MEKON Linking Package

Package: uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model.zlink

This package provides internal MEKON under-the-hood access of the uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model package, and is not relevant to either the client or the plugin code.
